name: Appknox
description: not free

name: Virustotal
description: max 128MB

name: Fraunhofer App-ray
description: not free

name: AppCritique
description: Upload your Android APKs and receive comprehensive free security assessments.

name: NowSecure Lab Automated
description: Enterprise tool for mobile app security testing both Android and iOS mobile apps. Lab Automated features dynamic and static analysis on real devices in the cloud to return results in minutes. Not free

name: AMAaaS
description: Free Android Malware Analysis Service. A baremetal service features static and dynamic analysis for Android applications. A product of MalwarePot.

name: App Detonator
description: Detonate APK binary to provide source code level details including app author, signature, build and manifest information. 3 Analysis/day free quota.

name: Pithus
description: Open-Source APK analyzer. Still in Beta for the moment and limited to static analysis for the moment. Possible to hunt malwares with Yara rules. More here.

name: Approver
description: Approver  is a fully automated security analysis and risk assessment platform for Android and iOS apps. Not free.

name: Androwarn
description: detect and warn the user about potential malicious behaviours developed by an Android application.

name: Droid Intent Data Flow Analysis for Information Leakage
PSCout
description: A tool that extracts the permission specification from the Android OS source code using static analysis

name: SmaliSCA
description: Smali Static Code Analysis

name: CFGScanDroid
description: Scans and compares CFG against CFG of malicious applications

name: Madrolyzer
description: extracts actionable data like C&C, phone number etc.

name: SPARTA
description: verifies (proves) that an app satisfies an information-flow security policy; built on the Checker Framework

name: ConDroid
description: Performs a combination of symbolic + concrete execution of the app

name: RiskInDroid
description: A tool for calculating the risk of Android apps based on their permissions, with online demo available.

name: SUPER
description: Secure, Unified, Powerful and Extensible Rust Android Analyzer

name: ClassyShark
description: Standalone binary inspection tool which can browse any Android executable and show important infos.

name: StaCoAn
description: Crossplatform tool which aids developers, bugbounty hunters and ethical hackers performing static code analysis on mobile applications. This tool was created with a big focus on usability and graphical guidance in the user interface.

name: JAADAS
description: Joint intraprocedure and interprocedure program analysis tool to find vulnerabilities in Android apps, built on Soot and Scala

name: Quark-Engine
description: An Obfuscation-Neglect Android Malware Scoring System

name: One Step Decompiler
description: Android APK Decompilation for the Lazy

name: APKLeaks
description: Scanning APK file for URIs, endpoints & secrets.

name: Mobile Audit
description: Web application for performing Static Analysis and detecting malware in Android APKs.

name: QARK
description: QARK by LinkedIn is for app developers to scan app for security issues

name: Oversecured
description: A mobile app vulnerability scanner, designed for security researchers and bug bounty hackers. It also allows integrations into the DevOps process for businesses.

name: Androl4b- A Virtual Machine For Assessing Android applications, Reverse Engineering and Malware Analysis
House- House: A runtime mobile application analysis toolkit with a Web GUI, powered by Frida, written in Python.
Mobile-Security-Framework MobSF
description: Mobile Security Framework is an intelligent, all-in-one open source mobile application (Android/iOS) automated pen-testing framework capable of performing static, dynamic analysis and web API testing.

name: Xposed
description: equivalent of doing Stub based code injection but without any modifications to the binary

name: Inspeckage
description: Android Package Inspector - dynamic analysis with api hooks, start unexported activities and more. (Xposed Module)

name: Android Hooker
description: Dynamic Java code instrumentation (requires the Substrate Framework)

name: ProbeDroid
description: Dynamic Java code instrumentation

name: Android Tamer
description: Virtual / Live Platform for Android Security Professionals

name: DECAF
description: Dynamic Executable Code Analysis Framework based on QEMU (DroidScope is now an extension to DECAF)

name: CuckooDroid
description: Android extension for Cuckoo sandbox

name: Mem
description: Memory analysis of Android (root required)

name: Crowdroid – unable to find the actual tool
AuditdAndroid – android port of auditd, not under active development anymore
Android Security Evaluation Framework
description: not under active development anymore

name: Aurasium – Practical security policy enforcement for Android apps via bytecode rewriting and in-place reference monitor.
Appie
description: Appie is a software package that has been pre-configured to function as an Android Pentesting Environment. It is completely portable and can be carried on USB stick or smartphone. This is a one stop answer for all the tools needed in Android Application Security Assessment and an awesome alternative to existing virtual machines.

name: StaDynA
description: a system supporting security app analysis in the presence of dynamic code update features (dynamic class loading and reflection). This tool combines static and dynamic analysis of Android applications in order to reveal the hidden/updated behavior and extend static analysis results with this information.

name: DroidAnalytics
description: incomplete

name: Vezir Project
description: Virtual Machine for Mobile Application Pentesting and Mobile Malware Analysis

name: MARA
description: Mobile Application Reverse engineering and Analysis Framework

name: Taintdroid
description: requires AOSP compilation

name: ARTist
description: a flexible open source instrumentation and hybrid analysis framework for Android apps and Android's java middleware. It is based on the Android Runtime's (ART) compiler and modifies code during on-device compilation.

name: AndroPyTool
description: a tool for extracting static and dynamic features from Android APKs. It combines different well-known Android apps analysis tools such as DroidBox, FlowDroid, Strace, AndroGuard or VirusTotal analysis.

name: Runtime Mobile Security (RMS)
description: is a powerful web interface that helps you to manipulate Android and iOS Apps at Runtime

name: PAPIMonitor – PAPIMonitor (Python API Monitor for Android apps) is a python tool based on Frida for monitoring user-select APIs during the app execution.
emacs syntax coloring for smali files
vim syntax coloring for smali files
Androguard – powerful, integrates well with other tools
Apktool – really useful for compilation/decompilation (uses smali)
Bypass signature and permission checks for IPCs
Android OpenDebug – make any application on device debuggable (using cydia substrate).

name: ARMANDroid
description: ARMAND (Anti-Repackaging through Multi-patternAnti-tampering based on Native Detection) is a novel anti-tampering protection scheme that embeds logic bombs and AT detection nodes directly in the apk file without needing their source code.

name: MVT (Mobile Verification Toolkit)
description: a collection of utilities to simplify and automate the process of gathering forensic traces helpful to identify a potential compromise of Android and iOS devices

name: An Android port of the melkor ELF fuzzer
FSquaDRA
description: a tool for detection of repackaged Android applications based on app resources hash comparison.

description: get app details and download apps from official Google Play Store.

description: download apps from Aptoide third-party Android market

name: Appland downloader (Node)
description: download apps from Appland third-party Android market

name: Apkpure
description: Online apk downloader. Provides also an own app for downloading.

name: PlaystoreDownloader
description: PlaystoreDownloader is a tool for downloading Android applications directly from the Google Play Store. After an initial (one-time) configuration, applications can be downloaded by specifying their package name.

name: AXMLPrinter2
description: to convert binary XML files to human-readable XML files

name: Android Vulnerability Test Suite
description: android-vts scans a device for set of vulnerabilities

name: AppMon- AppMon is an automated framework for monitoring and tampering system API calls of native macOS, iOS and android apps. It is based on Frida.
Internal Blue
description: Bluetooth experimentation framework based on Reverse Engineering of Broadcom Bluetooth Controllers

description: AMDH scans and harden device's settings and list harmful installed Apps based on permissions.
